description: Erection of single storey rear infill extensions
decision_conditions: By reason of the proposed depth of the extension, its lack of separation distance from the shared boundaries and the position of principal neighbouring habitable room windows at ground floor level, it is considered that the proposed development would be unneighbourly and would have an unacceptable adverse impact upon the amenities of neighbouring occupiers.  The proposed development would fail BRE Guidance in relation to the 45 degree rule and result in an unacceptable adverse impact in terms of loss of light, would create an undue sense of enclosure and would result in a loss of outlook to both Nos. 60 and 64 Douglas Road. The proposal is therefore considered to be contrary to Policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
The applicant is advised to seek planning permission through a householder application, after assessing the proposal against the guidelines set out under the council's Residential Design SPD.

On the 1st May 2024 the Council adopted a new Validation Local List. As per the new validation requirements, please complete and submit a Validation Checklist - Section 3. The new Validation  Local List and checklists can be obtained via the council's website: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applicationsThe LPA will not conduct any validation checks until the correct Checklist has been submitted. Upon receipt of a completed Checklist, the application will be assigned to a validation officer to review. Please do not simply state N/A in the checklist without a written justification.If you need to make any changes to your application please try to do this via the Planning Portal website where possible. If that is not possible please send amended documents via the email address quoted in this letter.
